description: A no-code friendly, practical introduction to modern AI for all roles—covering fundamentals, data & problem framing, model evaluation, deep learning & LLMs, prompting, and a delivery playbook for high-ROI pilots.

modules.name: AI Fundamentals & Types
modules.goal: Speak the language of AI; know what AI can and can’t do.
curriculum: What AI is (rules vs. ML), Narrow vs. General AI
Core types: supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning
Where AI shows up at work (search, recommendation, forecasting, GenAI)
Data → Model → Product value chain; inference vs. training
Limits: bias, hallucination, robustness, privacy
Hands-on (no-code): Try a browser demo (image/text classifier) and interpret results.
Deliverable: 1-page 'AI at my job' worksheet.

modules.name: Data & Problem Framing
modules.goal: Frame solvable AI problems and know what data you need.
curriculum: Define the business problem → map to ML task (classify, predict, generate)
Data lifecycle: collection, labeling, quality, drift
Metrics that matter: accuracy vs. recall/precision, business KPIs
Governance basics: consent, PII handling, DPDP/GDPR high-level view
Hands-on (no-code): Label a tiny sample, choose an evaluation metric for a use-case.
Deliverables: Problem Framing Canvas (template) + Data Checklist.

modules.name: Training, Validation & Testing
modules.goal: Understand how models are built and evaluated—without heavy math.
curriculum: Train/validation/test split; cross-validation; leakage to avoid
Overfitting vs. underfitting; bias–variance intuition
Classic models tour: linear/logistic, trees/ensembles (what to use when)
From offline accuracy to real-world reliability
Hands-on (no-code): Experiment with a prebuilt AutoML demo; compare two models.
Hands-on (dev track, optional): Quick notebook—train a logistic classifier; read a confusion matrix.
Deliverables: Evaluation Scorecard template.

modules.name: Deep Learning & LLMs
modules.goal: Build intuition for neural nets, embeddings, and transformers.
curriculum: Neural nets in plain English; why representation learning matters
Embeddings: meaning as vectors (search, clustering, similarity)
Transformers & attention; what makes LLMs powerful
Fine-tuning vs. prompting vs. parameter-efficient tuning; when to pick RAG
Safety & limitations: hallucinations, context length, latency/cost
Hands-on (no-code): Explore embeddings—find similar items in a small text set.
Deliverables: LLM Options Cheat-Sheet (open-source vs. API).

modules.name: Prompting & GenAI Productivity
modules.goal: Get reliable outputs from LLMs with reusable patterns.
curriculum: Prompt anatomy: role, context, constraints, examples
Core patterns: zero/few-shot, chain-of-thought, ReAct-style prompting
Structured outputs (JSON), style/voice control, citations scaffolding
Guard-rails: avoiding leakage, bias, and unsafe requests
Light automation: prompt templates and simple workflows
Hands-on: Build a mini prompt library for email rewrite, meeting notes, requirements draft, and Q&A with citations over a short doc.
Deliverables: Team Prompt Playbook (living doc).

modules.name: Use-Cases, ROI & the Delivery Playbook
modules.goal: Identify high-ROI candidates and plan a small pilot.
curriculum: Opportunity radar: effort–impact grid (marketing, ops, finance, HR, support)
Build vs. buy vs. partner (decision matrix + rough cost bands)
Minimal MLOps you should know: monitoring, drift, rollback, human-in-the-loop
Risk & compliance sign-offs; communicating uncertainty to stakeholders
90-day pilot plan: scope → data → model → deploy → measure
Hands-on: Fill the Opportunity & ROI Canvas for one real workflow.
Deliverables: 90-Day Pilot Plan template + KPI dashboard starter.
